care_path.name: Care path
care_path.description: Where the patients admitted to hospital for treatment, not admitted, or outpatients

numtreat_less62days.name: First treatment in less then 62 days
numtreat_less62days.description: Number​ of​ ​people​ receiving first​ treatment​ for​ cancer within​ 62​ ​days.

numtreat_more62days.name: First treatment after 62 days
numtreat_more62days.description: Number​ of​ people​​ receiving first treatment​ ​for​ ​cancer​ ​after 62​ days.

precenttreat_62days.name: First treatment in less then 62 days, proportional
precenttreat_62days.description: Proportion​ ​of​ patients​ ​that received​ ​ first​ ​ treatment​ ​ before 62​ ​days.

wait_within31.name: First treatment within 31 days
wait_within31.description: Number​ of​ ​people​ ​receiving first​ ​treatment​ ​for​ cancer within​ 31​ ​ days

wait_32to38.name: First treatment within 32 to 38 days
wait_32to38.description: Number​ ​ of​ ​ people​ ​ receivingfirst​ ​treatment​ ​for​ cancer within​ ​ 32​ ​ to​ ​ 38​ ​ days.

wait_49to62.name: First treatment within 49 to 62 days
wait_49to62.description: Number​ ​ of​ ​ people​ ​ receivingfirst​ ​treatment​ ​for​ cancer within​ ​ 49​ ​ to​ ​ 62​ ​ days.

wait_63to76.name: First treatment within 63 to 76 days
wait_63to76.description: Number​ ​ of​ ​ people​ ​ receivingfirst​ ​treatment​ ​for​ cancer within​ ​ 63 ​ to​ ​ 76 ​ days.

wait_77to90.name: First treatment within 77 to 90 days
wait_77to90.description: Number​ ​ of​ ​ people​ ​ receivingfirst​ ​treatment​ ​for​ cancer within​ ​ 77 ​ to​ ​ 90 ​ days.

wait_91to104.name: First treatment within 91 to 104 days
wait_91to104.description: Number​ ​ of​ ​ people​ ​ receivingfirst​ ​treatment​ ​for​ cancer within​ ​ 91 ​ to​ ​ 104 ​ days.

wait_104plus.name: First treatment after 104 days
wait_104plus.description: Number​ ​ of​ ​ people​ ​ receiving first​ ​ treatment​ ​ for​ ​ cancer​ ​ after 104​ ​ days.

shmi_ind.name: SHMI Index
shmi_ind.description: This​ ​ variable​ ​ is​ ​ calculated​ ​ from the​ ​ ratio​ ​ between​ ​ the​ ​ actual number​ ​ of​ ​ patients​ ​ who​ ​ die following​ ​ hospitalisation​ ​ at​ ​ the trust​ ​ ( ​ observed_deaths​ ) ​ ​ and the​ ​ number​ ​ that​ ​ would​ ​ be expected​ ​ to​ ​ die​ ​ on​ ​ the​ ​ basis​ ​ of average​ ​ England​ ​ figures (​ expected_deaths​ ),​ ​ given​ ​ the characteristics​ ​ of​ ​ the​ ​ patients treated​ ​ there.​ ​ ​ It​ ​ includes deaths​ ​ which​ ​ occur​ ​ in​ ​ hospital and​ ​ deaths​ ​ which​ ​ occur outside​ ​ of​ ​ hospital​ ​ within​ ​ 30 days​ ​ (inclusive)​ ​ of​ ​ discharge. The​ ​ SHMI​ ​ gives​ ​ an​ ​ indication for​ ​ each​ ​ non-specialist​ ​ acute NHS​ ​ trust​ ​ in​ ​ England​ ​ whether the​ ​ observed​ ​ number​ ​ of deaths​ ​ within​ ​ 30​ ​ days​ ​ of discharge​ ​ from​ ​ hospital​ ​ was 'above​ ​ expected'​ ​ (SHMI value>1)​ ​ or​ ​ 'lower​ ​ than expected'​ ​ (SHMI​ ​ value<1). Breast​ ​ cancer​ ​ = ​ ​ diagnosis category​ ​ group​ ​ 18 Colon​ ​ cancer​ ​ = ​ ​ diagnosis category​ ​ group 10 Lung​ ​ cancer​ ​ = ​ ​ diagnosis category​ ​ group​ ​ 15

cat_beds_day.name: Available daybeds
cat_beds_day.description: The​ ​ total​ ​ number​ ​ of​ ​ available beds​ ​ (day​ ​ only)​ ​ for​ ​ general​ ​ and acute

cat_beds_night.name: Available nightbeds
cat_beds_night.description: The​ ​ total​ ​ number​ ​ of​ ​ available beds​ ​ (night ​ only)​ ​ for​ ​ general​ ​ and acute

cat_Emergency_Medicine.name: Number of emergency medicine staff (in FTE)

cat_General_medicine_group.name: Number of general medicine staff (in FTE)

ytd_actual.name: Year-to-date​ ​ (YTD)​ ​ actual financial​ ​ balance​
ytd_actual.description: Year-to-date​ ​ (YTD)​ ​ actual financial​ ​ balance​ ​ of​ ​ trust

ytd_plan_miss.name: Financial performance
ytd_plan_miss.description: 1​ ​ = ​ ​ trust​ ​ did​ ​ not​ ​ reach​ ​ planned YTD​ ​ balance,​ ​ 0 ​ ​ = ​ ​ trust​ ​ reached or​ ​ did​ ​ better​ ​ than​ ​ forecasted

deficit.name: Financial deficit
deficit.description: 1​ ​ = ​ ​ trusts​ ​ that​ ​ are​ ​ in​ ​ deficit​ ​ i.e. with​ ​ a ​ ​ negative​ ​ balance,​ ​ 0 ​ ​ = trusts​ ​ not​ ​ in​ ​ deficit
